text:
Sightseeing Munich: Overview of all sights • muenchen.de Search Close search Anzeige Branchenbuch Suchbegriff(e) eingeben Search Menu Anzeige Branchenbuch Navigation Language City Hall Events Culture, Leisure Restaurants Shopping Sights Tourism Hotels Business Living Transportation Aktuelle Sprache: English Deutsch Français Italiano Español Русский العربية 中文 Home Sights Home Ad Branchenbuch Sights and sightseeing in Munich This is a carousel with rotating cards. Use the previous and next buttons to
              navigate, and Enter to activate cards. Previous Slide 1 / 3 Exhibitions, opening hours, tips for families Discover Munich's museums Discover Munich's museums Classic tourist attractions and hidden gems 2 / 3 A sustainable visit Suggestions for your stay Suggestions for your stay 3 / 3 Under your own steam Ski touring Ski touring Next Slide Nymphenburg Palace Check out the summer residence of Bavarian monarchs Viktualienmarkt What the unique market in the center of the city has to offer New Town Hall (Neues Rathaus) The New Town Hall is one of the most distinctive features of Munich's skyline Hellabrunn Zoo Home to more than 750 exotic and native species Top must-see attractions in Munich Experience the highlights of Munich: the most impressive sights Frauenkirche Impressive interior with works of art spanning five centuries Ad Explore Munich the local way Unforgettable city tours and sightseeing tours by Radius Tours Munich – your local guide GET YOUR TICKET HERE State Library, National Theater, Castles and Palaces Alter Hof The Old Court (Alter Hof) is located in the middle of Munich's old town Bavarian State Library The building in the center of Munich is worth seeing The exhibitions are currently closed Münchner Stadtmuseum: Closed for modernization Residence: Top sight in Munich Why a visit to the palace is definitely worthwile New Schleißheim Palace Home of the State Gallery of European Baroque Painting and more Neuschwanstein Castle Check out the famous "fairytale castle" of Ludwig II Simply Munich Is it really all Munich? Overview and test: Munich neighbourhoods The Nativity scene collection Away in a manger… Guided tour Old town Guided tour District tour: hood love Guided tour Münchner Kindl Museums Free museums in Munich Here you get free entry and discounts Deutsches Museum One of the most popular museums for science and technology in the world NS Documentation Center Learn more about the NS dictatorship in a current and global context All Museums Churches Church of St. Peter The tower of St. Peter offers some of the best views of the city You should see these churches From glass cubes to baroque pomp - 6 mind-blowing churches Theatiner Church at Odeonsplatz A major influence on the Southern German baroque architecture All Churches Isar, Parks and Gardens Isar river Discover the perfect place in Munich to relax Flaucher (river bank) in Munich The so-called "Isar Riviera" is a popular meeting place for barbecues English Garden The 900-acre park is best known for its beer gardens and sunbathers Olympiapark This park has great landscape, sport facilities, lakes and concert venues Westpark Illuminated artworks and a laid-back waterfront café await Hofgarten A paradise of relaxation - it borders the Odeonsplatz to the east Botanical Garden in Nymphenburg Take a tour through flowers and greenhouses Maximiliansanlagen A green park next to the river Isar Old Botanical Garden A quiet park in the center of Munich Downtown Neuhauser Straße Famous and popular: Neuhauser Straße and Kaufingerstraße Sendlinger Tor The old city gate with remains of a medieval city wall Isartor The old city gate - home to the Valentin Karlstadt Museum Squares Münchner Freiheit The central meeting place and hub in Munich-Schwabing Gärtnerplatz The Gärtnerplatz is a great relaxation spot and meeting point Marienplatz Discover Munich's central square in the middle of the old town Tours See the best of Munich in just 24 hours! See most of the city in 24 hours - Here are our tips A city tour by tram Streetcar 19 passes many sights and is ideal for a short city tour Ad MGV: official and independent Tourist Guides of Munich Towers The Olympic Tower What you can do on Munich's tallest building Chinesischer Turm Perhaps the most renowned spot in the Englischer Garten Viewpoints The Olympic Tower The platforms from the Olympic Tower offer an unsurpassable view The 7 most beautiful viewpoints From the old town panorama to the romanticism of a railway bridge Roof terraces and rooftop bars A drink with a view of the city’s rooftops and skyline Angel of Peace (Friedensengel) Great view of the city and a golden sea of colours Theresienwiese: Home to the Oktoberfest What you need to know about Munich’s most famous “Wiese” Fröttmaning hill Here you have a great view of Munich and the Alps Fliegender Brief muenchen.de als Newsletter! Mit aktuellen Highlights, Tipps und Infos. E-Mail Adresse Rechtsgrundlage für die Verarbeitung Eurer E-Mail Adresse ist Art. 6 Abs. 1 a) DSGVO in Verbindung mit Eurer Einwilligung. Ihr könnte Eure Einwilligung jederzeit mit Wirkung für die Zukunft widerrufen, am Einfachsten durch Anklicken des Abmeldelinks am Ende des entsprechenden E-Mail-Newsletters.
